Of all gunblades (a sword-gun weapon), the finest{Line}model is the Lionheart.{Line}It requires rare items to be remodeled to its{Line}highest quality. Good luck!
Next, we show you the finest projectile weapon,{Line}the Shooting Star.{Line}Don"t let the angel wing motif fool you.{Line}It"s a deadly weapon.
Exeter comes to mind when considering high-{Line}powered guns.{Line}Despite its simple design, it"s a fine weapon made{Line}of many rare metals.
This Strange Vision is famous for its ability to hit{Line}a target with perfect accuracy.{Line}It"s also famous for its rarity.
This time, we introduce a basic weapon.{Line}The gunblade"s original model is this Revolver.{Line}What it lacks in power, it more than makes up for{Line}with its reliability.
A punch can be a deadly weapon, but it can be{Line}made even more effective by wearing these, the{Line}Metal Knuckle.{Line}These gloves are widely used.
Even a weakling can cause serious damage{Line}with this type of nunchaku, but they"re{Line}also hard to use. This Flail has long been{Line}a favorite for beginners.
Whips are effective against enemies that are close{Line}or far away.{Line}This Chain Whip has a simple design, but is very{Line}reliable in battle.
An improvement in power over the Revolver, Shear{Line}Trigger uses the same blade as the Revolver, but{Line}the gun aspect is now more powerful.
With the Maverick, the combatant can deliver direct{Line}punching blows to the enemy.{Line}The gloves are made of black leather and have{Line}metal plates on the knuckles.
Weapons that can be used from a distance have{Line}many advantages.{Line}The Pinwheel is one of the more basic projectile{Line}weapons.
Guns have the advantage of range, but damage is{Line}less compared to swords.{Line}The Valiant uses powerful bullets to cause damage{Line}comparable to a sword.
This Cutting Trigger is the latest model of{Line}gunblade, made by replacing the blade of the{Line}Revolver with the powerful Cutting Sword.
Valkyrie is a projectile weapon that can fly{Line}straight at the enemy using its stabilizing fins.{Line}The blade is extremely deadly.
The Ulysses lacks style, but is a quality rifle with{Line}tremendous firepower.{Line}The inelegant design was necessary to absorb the{Line}powerful recoil after firing.
This whip, the Slaying Tail, is known for its{Line}tremendous speed and power.{Line}It is named after Sleipner, the horse of the{Line}legendary GF, Odin.
The Flame Saber got its name from its red blade.{Line}This gunblade is very similar to the Shear Trigger.{Line}The only difference is that it has the Cutting{Line}Trigger"s handle.
The Gauntlet is covered with layers of steel.{Line}It is a fighting glove for delivering heavy rather{Line}than smooth blows.
The ends of the Morning Star were equipped with{Line}spiked metal balls to cause more damage.{Line}It is a plain weapon, similar to nunchaku, but it is{Line}fairly effective.
The Red Scorpion is a unique whip made of rare{Line}materials.{Line}It"s strength comes from the dragon skin, while it"s{Line}flexibility comes from the Ochu tentacle.{Line}
The Twin Lance is a gunblade forged with two{Line}blades. The two blades work synergistically to{Line}inflict severe damage.{Line}The only drawback is its heavy weight.{Line}
The Rising Sun is similar to a circular saw.{Line}It is made by upgrading the Pinwheel.{Line}It is capable of slicing into enemies like a spinning{Line}saw and dealing a devastating blow.
Contrary to the Ulysses, the Bismarck has a sleek{Line}look. The rifle is very handy and light, but in turn,{Line}requires more physical strength and energy to{Line}handle its powerful recoil.
The Crescent Wish is an extremely powerful{Line}nunchaku.{Line}Some rare items are required to forge this weapon.
The Punishment looks almost identical to the Twin{Line}Lance, but it is lighter and more powerful.{Line}The only gunblade more powerful than this is the{Line}Lionheart.
Ehrgeiz is the most powerful fighting glove.{Line}It allows the wearer to deliver optimal hits based{Line}on his or her ability.
The Cardinal is the latest line of projectile weapons.{Line}The wide fins provide more stability and accuracy{Line}compared to the Valkyrie.{Line}Its greater accuracy causes more damage.
Save the Queen is the most powerful whip in the{Line}world.{Line}It is made with Malboro"s tentacles which are the{Line}most ideal material for making whips.
Combat King 001 Sea Power! Dolphin Blow

Do you guys know what a Dolphin is?{Line}It"s an adorable gray mammal that lives in the{Line}ocean.{Line}This skill, called the {Color Blue}Dolphin Blow{Color White}, draws out the{Line}secret power of the dolphin.{Line}It"ll give the enemy a hell of a show!{Line}
Study the skill carefully.{Line}Remember, always use it for a good cause, ok!?{Line}
Combat King 002 Power Blow! Meteor Strike

Picking up your enemy and slamming them on the{Line}ground probably does the most damage.{Line}That"s what {Color Blue}Meteor Strike{Color White} accomplishes.{Line}And, of course, the bigger they are, the harder{Line}they fall.{Line}
This is one of the hardest moves to do, but{Line}study it carefully and you"ll eventually get it.{Line}Remember, always use it for a good cause, ok!?{Line}
Combat King 003 Final blow! Meteor Barret

As a fighter, you will occasionally encounter near-{Line}death experiences.{Line}Using {Color Blue}Meteor Barret{Color White} in these situations may be{Line}your only chance to emerge victorious.{Line}It is a skill that throws all your energy against{Line}the enemy.
Being a finishing blow, it inflicts tremendous damage{Line}against the enemy.{Line}Remember, always use it for a good cause, ok!?{Line}
Combat King 004 Aerial Finish! Different Beat

The enemy can"t do anything if you lift them up in{Line}the air.{Line}With {Color Blue}Different Beat{Color White}, you can kick the enemy up in{Line}the air and keep kicking them while they remain{Line}completely defenseless.{Line}
This is really an efficient skill so it"s worthwhile{Line}to get it down.{Line}Remember, always use it for a good cause, ok!?{Line}
Combat King 005 Super Dash! My Final Heaven

E = 1/2 x M x V x V E: Energy. M: Mass.{Line}V: Velocity. Apparently, if you increase the{Line}velocity, the energy goes up.{Line}This skill is based on this physics equation.{Line}At a velocity near the speed of light, you can{Line}do major damage!
Get this skill, {Color Blue}My Final Heaven{Color White}, down and check out{Line}the high-speed thrashing!{Line}Remember, always use it for a good cause, ok!?{Line}

Welcome to Pet Pals.{Line}We bring the latest pet news to dog{Line}lovers.{Line}Your dog learns a trick to damage{Line}enemies in this issue.{Line}Your dog comes to your rescue when{Line}you are in grave danger.{Line}It"s called...{Line} {Color Blue}{Char Angelo2} Strike{Color White}!{Line}As you dog lovers already know, walk with your{Line}dog to help him learn this trick.

Have you ever wished your pet could{Line}rescue you in battle?{Line}This is just the trick for your dog to{Line}learn!{Line}Your dog finds and uses potions and{Line}other cures on a member who"s near{Line}KO with this trick.{Line}It is called{Line} {Color Blue}{Char Angelo2} Recover{Color White}!{Line}A very nice trick, indeed.

Research shows a relationship between{Line}the moon and your dog.{Line}Do you know how your dog can use the{Line}power of the moon to help you?{Line}It"s...{Line} {Color Blue}Invincible Moon{Color White}!{Line}The moon"s mysterious power can{Line}make all allies invincible.{Line}Do a lot of walking with your dog to help him learn{Line}this trick!

Have you ever been KO"d by a{Line}monster?{Line}Even reviving doesn"t help, because{Line}you get KO"d right back.{Line}To answer your desperate call for{Line}help,{Line}use{Line} {Color Blue}{Char Angelo2} Reverse{Color White}!{Line}Your dog finds Phoenix Downs to{Line}revive KO"d party members in battle.

Item hunting!{Line}Sounds like a daunting task?{Line}But it"s true that you need items to{Line}do anything.{Line}So let"s have your dog learn another{Line}trick.{Line}It"s...{Line} {Color Blue}{Char Angelo2} Search{Color White}!{Line}Your dog finds items while you are fighting.{Line}Be sure to praise your dog when s/he finds an{Line}item!{Line}

Have you ever wanted to achieve a{Line}goal together with your pet?{Line}Make it come true, using{Line} {Color Blue}Wishing Star{Color White}!{Line}Attack enemies together!{Line}The power of love multiplies your{Line}powers by 10 to 20 times to defeat{Line}your enemies.{Line}Try it, you"ll like it!{Line}
Occult Fan I Exclusive{Line}Mysterious Monster Death!!!
Odell Burk(67) of Timber was{Line}tending to his field when he{Line}found a dead monster after{Line}hearing a loud impact sound.{Line}
Mr. Burk said it{Line}occured while he{Line}was making a fence{Line}with steel pipes.{Line}
On the left is a{Line}photo shot in{Line}Esthar.{Line}Take a look at the{Line}unidentified flying{Line}object in the center.{Line}
Have you ever seen any monster or airplane{Line}like this!? Some say it may be Esthar"s secret{Line}weapon, but residents of the area say it appears{Line}when there is a major Malboro outbreak.
Occult Fan III Magic World Exclusive
Look at this picture.{Line}This is a confidential photo of{Line}what is assumed to be a ring{Line}that summons a GF.{Line}Legend goes that it was{Line}a ring that belonged to a royal
family.{Line}Its name and whereabouts are unknown.{Line}The legend says you must have 666 items to{Line}summon the GF.{Line}
Occult Fan IV Exclusive Report{Line}Unidentified Flying Object Revealed!?
Our research on the deadly flying{Line}object revealed that a Devil (left){Line}may be flying and attacking{Line}people.{Line}
Neither has been proven, but people{Line}that were attacked all owned ST{Line}Full Recovery Medicine.{Line}
A status window showing the character, HP, and{Line}ATB gauges is displayed on the battle screen.{Line} Characters can act once the ATB gauge is full.{Line}

Commands are displayed when{Line}the ATB is full.{Line} Use the directional buttons to{Line}choose.{Line} Press {Key Confirm} to confirm the{Line}command.{Line} Press {Key x3B} while the cursor{Line}is on-screen to see a help{Line}message.{Line}

To use {Color Blue}Magic{Color White}, select one{Line}magic and choose your{Line}target.{Line} The number in stock is{Line}indicated next to the{Line}magic"s name.{Line} The {Key JunctionSYM} indicates that the{Line}magic is junctioned.{Line}
When {Color Blue}Item{Color White} is chosen,{Line}select the item and its{Line}target.{Line} The number next to{Line}each item shows how{Line}many items the party{Line}has.{Line}
{Color Blue}GF{Color White} summons a GF{Line}junctioned to a{Line}character.{Line}Select a GF and its{Line}target.{Line} The number next{Line}to the GF"s name{Line}shows its HP.{Line}

{Color Blue}Draw{Color White} extracts magic{Line}from enemies.{Line} Choose a target and{Line}magic, then {Color Blue}Stock{Color White} or{Line}{Color Blue}Cast{Color White}.{Line} {Color Blue}Stock{Color White} will stock the{Line}magic and {Color Blue}Cast{Color White} will cast{Line}the magic.{Line}

When running low on HP, {Key Arrow_Right}{Line}may appear next to {Color Blue}Attack{Color White}.{Line} Press the right directional{Line}button.{Line} This new command is more{Line}powerful than the usual{Line}{Color Blue}Attack{Color White}.{Line} This is a Limit Break.{Line}

{Line}-Press {Key RotateLeft} to choose your{Line} target from a window.{Line}-Hold {Key EscapeLeft} and {Key EscapeRight} to escape,{Line} though there are some{Line} battles from which you cannot escape.{Line}-EXP is gained even if you escape,{Line} as long as you damaged the enemy.
The cards originated{Line}when a psychic named{Line}Orlan modified these tarot{Line}cards for games.{Line}The game became popular{Line}with soldiers passing time {Line}between battles.
As its popularity spread, each region developed its{Line}own rules and picture variations.{Line}

1.Picture{Line}2.Numbers{Line} Correspond to the 4{Line} sides of the card.{Line} (1:weak - A:strong){Line}3.Element{Line} Some rules allow{Line} the players to use{Line} its elemental property.{Line}
1.Battle area{Line} Place cards here one at{Line} a time.{Line}2.Elemental{Line} Some rules indicate{Line} elements on the board.{Line}
Cards are placed in turn,{Line}and the player with the{Line}most cards when all 9{Line}areas are filled wins.{Line}
Choose 5 cards before{Line}you begin.{Line}Pay attention to numbers{Line}and elements.{Line}{Line}1.Card name{Line}2.# in stock{Line}3.Page number{Line}4.Card chosen

{Color Blue}Same{Color White} turns over cards{Line}that have same # values{Line}on 2 or more sides.{Line}In the example, #s 4 and{Line}1 are adjacent to top{Line}and left sides.{Line}This turns over the top{Line}and left cards.

{Color Blue}Plus{Color White} means that cards{Line}adding to the same # on{Line}more than 2 adjacent{Line}sides are turned over.{Line}In the example, the cards{Line}placed add up to 7 on the{Line}top and left sides.{Line}The cards on top and left{Line}are turned over.{Line}

Cards turned over using{Line}{Color Blue}Same{Color White} or {Color Blue}Plus{Color White} turn over{Line}adjacent cards in {Color Blue}Combo{Color White}.{Line}In the example, red will {Line}be turned over because{Line}1 of the 2 cards turned{Line}over is a larger #.

{Color Blue}Same Wall{Color White} uses Battle{Line}Area wall (the frame) as{Line}1 of card"s 4 sides when{Line}using {Color Blue}Same{Color White} rule.{Line}Wall is assumed to have{Line}‘A" value on all sides.

{Color Blue}Elemental{Color White} changes the #{Line}value of the card depending{Line}on the elemental property.{Line}When a card and slot match{Line}elemental properties, the{Line}# value increases by 1.{Line}If elements don"t match,{Line}the card loses 1 from the{Line}original # value.{Line}

{Color Blue}Open{Color White}{Line} All cards face up.{Line}{Color Blue}Random{Color White}{Line} Cards chosen at random.{Line}{Color Blue}Sudden Death{Color White}{Line} Play until someone wins.{Line}

Cards are traded when the game is over.{Line}The winner takes 1 card from the loser in the{Line}basic trade rule {Color Blue}One{Color White}.{Line}There are many trade rules besides {Color Blue}One{Color White}.{Line}Pay attention to trade rules before you begin{Line}a game.

{Color Blue}Direct{Color White}{Line} Take cards you turned over, but lose cards{Line} turned over by the opponent.{Line}{Color Blue}Diff{Color White}{Line} Winner takes the number of cards by which s/he{Line} won.{Line}{Color Blue}All{Color White}{Line} The winner takes all the cards from the loser.{Line}

Mog, a MiniMog, wants to go{Line}treasure hunting with his{Line}friends.{Line}But the treasure is in the{Line}‘Scary Mountain".{Line}Everybody tells Mog, ”We"re{Line}not going! It"s too scary!“{Line}
But Mog wants to go so badly.{Line}No one can stop him now!
Mog finally decided to go by{Line}himself.{Line}Then... Two days passed...{Line}Three days passed.{Line}Mog did not come home.{Line}Moomba and Cactuar imagined{Line}Mog being barbecued by the{Line}
Demon King.{Line}”We have to go help Mog with Chicobo!“
Moomba said, ”I"ll find weapons!“{Line}Cactuar said, ”I"ll find treasures!“{Line}What"s Chicobo doing with a TV and Fishing Pole?

� {Color Blue}What is Solo-RPG!?{Color White} 1/8{Line} Chocobo World is a Solo-RPG.{Line} Just as the word ”Solo“ implies, it is a game all{Line} by itself.{Line} Combined with the word RPG, it means it plays an{Line} RPG by itself.{Line} So the game can progress on its own.{Line} Not to worry, though!{Line} Chicobo awaits your command in wait mode!

� ��� {Color Blue}Walk Screen{Color White} 3/8{Line}1: Game progresses on the Walk Screen{Line} and stops on the Menu Screen.{Line}2: Chicobo wanders off when HP aren"t{Line} full. Scold it with the enter button!{Line}3: Events happen here!{Line}

� � {Color Blue}Event Screen{Color White} 4/8{Line}1: Cactuar gives you an item.{Line}2: Acquired items.{Line}3: Moomba gives you a weapon.{Line}4: Select a weapon.{Line}5: Battle is also an event.{Line}6: Hope you find Mog!{Line}7: ON: You control Chicobo.{Line} OFF: Chicobo"s on his own.{Line}

� ���� {Color Blue}Battle Screen{Color White} 5/8{Line}1: HP: Battle ends when HP reads 0.{Line}2: ATB: Attacks when this bar reads 0.{Line}3: If you find Mog, go to the Menu Screen{Line}4: and select STAND BY. He"ll help{Line} you when you"re in danger!{Line}5: Receive magic stones by winning{Line} battles. Bingo levels you up!{Line}

Events occur{Line} when they meet!{Line}2: Set direction with up/down buttons.{Line}3: Map number: level up to next map.{Line}4: Time: ChocoboWorld time.{Line}5: Move Screen: Use up/down button to{Line} set. Higher number covers more ground.{Line}

� ��� {Color Blue}Status Screen{Color White} 7/8{Line}1: WPN: Randomly chooses 1 of the 4{Line} damage points in battle.{Line}2: Chicobo"s level{Line}3: Current HP/Maximum HP{Line}4: ID signifies Chicobo"s rank.{Line}5: Check number of items collected.{Line} A is the best of the 4 items.{Line} Find out what it is back in FF��.{Line}

��{Color Blue}Optical Communication Screen{Color White} 8/8{Line}1: Neutral position.{Line}2: Receiver selects the bottom.{Line}3: Sender selects the top.{Line}4: Operate like any other battle.{Line} The Chicobo on the right is yours.{Line}5: Take your opponent"s ID{Line} if you win. Compare with your{Line} own. Select it like a weapon.{Line}

1: Select {Color Blue}World{Color White} to move Chicobo{Line} into ChocoboWorld.{Line}2: Select {Color Blue}Home{Color White} to move Chicobo{Line} back into FF�� world.{Line}3: If you want to start over{Line} from where you left off,{Line} select {Color Blue}Do over{Color White}.{Line}4: {Color Blue}How to play{Color White}: This tutorial.{Line}

This executes Junction related commands.{Line}{Line} {Option x20}3Junction Menu{Line} {Option x20}4GFJunction{Line} {Option x20}5Magic Junction{Line} {Option x20}/Off{Line} {Option x20}:Auto{Line} {Option x20}!Setting Ability{Line}

There are 2 types of Junction: {Color Green}GF Junction{Color White} and{Line}{Color Green}Magic Junction{Color White}.{Line}{Line}Choose {Color Blue}Junction{Color White} command in the menu and the party{Line}member to junction.{Line}The screen switches to the Junction menu.{Line}Ability setting is done on the same Junction screen.{Line}

Signifies junctioning a GF to an ally.{Line}Choose {Color Blue}Junction{Color White} on the junction menu, then choose{Line}the {Color Blue}GF{Color White} command that appears.{Line}When {Color Blue}GF{Color White} command is selected, a screen shows all GF{Line}acquired.{Line}Select a GF.{Line}More than one GF can be junctioned to one ally.{Line}GF junctioned to the current character show up in{Line}gray, while GF junctioned to other allies show up as{Line}ghost text.{Line}

Signifies junctioning magic to an ally.{Line}There are 5 categories:{Line}{Line} {Option x20}6Stat Junction{Line} {Option x20}7Elemental Attack Junction{Line} {Option x20}8Elemental Defense Junction{Line} {Option x20}9Status Attack Junction{Line} {Option x20}%Status Defense Junction{Line}
Signifies junctioning magic to HP, Vit, etc. to raise{Line}their value.{Line}The effect is different for each magic spell, but any{Line}magic can be junctioned.{Line}

Signifies junctioning magic to Elem-Atk.{Line}Only magic with an elemental property can be{Line}junctioned.{Line}Once junctioned, {Color Blue}Attack{Color White} has an elemental property.{Line}100% makes the elemental stat perfect.{Line}When attacking an enemy that receives twice the{Line}damage by Fire attacks; with fire stat 100%,{Line}character inflicts twice the damage, but with 50%,{Line}damage only amounts to 1.5 times.{Line}

Signifies junctioning magic to Elem-Def.{Line}Only magic with an elemental property can be{Line}junctioned.{Line}This elemental junction has no effect on the magic{Line}the character is using.{Line}Defense stat is shown as a %, with a max of 100%{Line}against that element.{Line}Once the stat passes 100%, the character absorbs{Line}the attacks at maximum of 100%.{Line}

Signifies junctioning magic to ST-Atk.{Line}Only magic with status changing effects can be{Line}junctioned.{Line}Once junctioned, {Color Blue}Attack{Color White} command has a status{Line}property.{Line}Status-change stat is shown as a %, with a{Line}maximum of 100%.{Line}Status change may occur depending on the enemy"s{Line}status defense power.

Signifies junctioning magic to ST-Def.{Line}Only magic with defense against status changes{Line}can be junctioned.{Line}This defense junction has no effect on the magic{Line}the character is using.{Line}Junction gives protection from that status change.{Line}Defense stat is shown as a %, with a max of 100%.{Line}Certain attacks can bypass even a 100% defense{Line}stat, so it is not a perfect defense.

Signifies taking off magic and GF that are{Line}junctioned.{Line}There are two commands to do this.{Line}{Line} {Color Blue}Magic{Color White}{Line} Leaves the GF alone, while taking off all magic that{Line} is junctioned.{Line}{Line} {Color Blue}All{Color White}{Line} Takes off all junctioned magic and GF.{Line}

This junctions magic automatically.{Line}There are 3 different commands, depending on the{Line}ability you want to emphasize.{Line}{Line}{Color Blue}Atk{Color White}{Line} Emphasizes fighting ability.{Line}{Color Blue}Mag{Color White}{Line} Emphasizes magic ability.{Line}{Color Blue}Def{Color White}{Line} Emphasizes defensive ability.{Line}

This sets an ability to a character.{Line}Junctioned GF abilities can also be set.{Line}{Line}Up to 3 command abilities can be set in the{Line}command box.{Line}Up to 2 Character or Party abilities can be set in{Line}the ability box.{Line}However, there is a GF ability that allows 4 abilities{Line}to be set.{Line}
This executes item-related commands.{Line}{Line}{Option x20}…Use{Line}{Option x20}-Rearrange{Line}{Option x20}+Sort{Line}{Option x20}=Battle{Line}
This allows use of items in menu mode.{Line}{Line}Choose the party member or GF after choosing an{Line}item.{Line}{Line}Items shown in gray cannot be used in menu.{Line}
This automatically sorts items.{Line}{Line}Items are sorted by type.{Line}{Line}Items missing are ignored in this process.{Line}
This allows you to rearrange items by{Line}preference.{Line}{Line}After choosing an item, select a location for it.{Line}{Line}Items switch place or places themselves in an empty{Line}space.{Line}

Items are placed according to preference, for use{Line}in battle.{Line}{Line}It is the same as {Color Blue}Rearrange{Color White}, the difference being{Line}that item placement is optimized for battle.{Line}Items switch place or places with an empty space{Line}automatically.{Line}
This executes magic-related commands.{Line}{Line} {Option x20}&Use {Line} {Option x20}「Exchg.{Line} {Option x20}」All {Line} {Option x20})Rearrange {Line}

This allows you to use magic in the menu screen.{Line}Choose an ally, then select the magic and a target{Line}to activate the magic.{Line}However, magic that causes damage or that would{Line}have no effect in the menu is not activated.{Line}KO"d, Petrified, or Silenced allies cannot use magic,{Line}even in the menu.{Line}At this time, pressing {Key Cards} after choosing a magic{Line}discards that magic.{Line}

This exchanges magic between allies.{Line}Choose an ally, then select the magic and choose a{Line}character to exchange with.{Line}If the target already owns the same magic, {Color Blue}Give{Line}All/Take All/Split{Color White} are displayed.{Line}If the opposite is true, choose magic to switch or{Line}choose from {Color Blue}Give All{Color White} or {Color Blue}Split{Color White} when choosing a blank{Line}slot.{Line}To discard it, choose magic and press {Key Cards}.{Line}

This transfers all magic from one ally to another.{Line}Choose the ally receiving Magic, then choose the{Line}one giving, and the command is executed.{Line}No single type of Magic can have more than 100{Line}in its stock, nor can a character have more than{Line}32 different types of magic at once.{Line}Excess magic is retained by the ally giving the{Line}magic.

Allows placement of magic according to{Line}preference for use in battle.{Line}{Line} Magic switches place with another, or{Line}sets itself in a blank slot.{Line} You can also discard magic by pressing{Line}{Key Cards} after selecting the magic.{Line}

Arrange magic in the Magic Screen for battle.{Line}{Line} {Option x20}·Manual{Line} {Option x20}.Attack·Restore·Indirect{Line} {Option x20},Attack·Indirect·Restore{Line} {Option x20}~Restore·Attack·Indirect{Line} {Option x20}“Restore·Indirect·Attack{Line} {Option x20}”Indirect·Attack·Restore{Line} {Option x20}‘Indirect·Restore·Attack{Line}

Allows you to rearrange the magic freely.{Line}When exchanging magic, they switch places.{Line}When exchanging magic with a blank slot, they{Line}switch places, leaving the old slot blank.{Line}{Line}Discard magic by pressing {Key Cards}.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Attack Magic· Recovery Magic· Indirect Magic.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Attack Magic· Indirect Magic· Recovery Magic.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Recovery Magic· Attack Magic· Indirect Magic.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Recovery Magic· Indirect Magic· Attack Magic.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Indirect Magic· Attack Magic· Recovery Magic.{Line}
{Line}Rearrange magic by type in the following order:{Line}Indirect Magic· Recovery Magic· Attack Magic.{Line}

See information on a character.{Line} 4 status screens will be displayed.{Line}{Line} 1: Shows HP, Level, EXP, and Abilities.{Line} 2: Elem-Atk, Elem-Def, ST-Atk, ST-Def screen.{Line} 3: Shows compatibility with GF{Line} 4: Shows Special Skills.{Line} This screen differs with each ally.{Line} Some can choose attack auto function.{Line}

See information on GF.{Line}When selected, a GF"s status screen is displayed{Line}to show HP, Level, etc.{Line}{Line}Choose {Color Blue}Learn{Color White} in the status screen to check which{Line}abilities have been learned, and choose an ability{Line}to learn.{Line}
This allows you to use a GF"s {Color Green}Menu Ability{Color White}.{Line}When chosen, all learned abilities are shown.{Line}Choose one to activate.{Line}
Switch party members.{Line}Also transfers corresponding junctions.{Line}{Line} {Option x20}ASwitch Member{Line} {Option x20}BJunction Exchange{Line}
Switch party members.{Line}{Line}Select characters with the cursor to switch party{Line}members.{Line}{Line}At times, characters cannot be switched even if{Line}they are displayed.

Transfers the characters" magic, junctioned GF,{Line}and set abilities to the selected character.{Line}{Line}You are free to switch transfers by selecting{Line}characters that are displayed.{Line}{Line}

ATB stands for {Color Green}Active Time Battle{Color White}.{Line}With time running during battle, enemies keep{Line}attacking even while the current character waits.{Line}Thus, it is important to make decisions quickly{Line}during battle.{Line}{Line}ATB can be set to Wait in the Config screen.{Line}Wait mode gives more time to decide on a command.{Line}

Once the ATB gauge is full, the command window{Line}opens up.{Line}Select a command to execute.{Line}Commands shown are {Color Blue}Attack{Color White}, and other abilities{Line}set in Junction.{Line}{Line}Commands like {Color Blue}Magic{Color White} , {Color Blue}GF{Color White}, and {Color Blue}Item{Color White} must be set in{Line}Junction to use in battle.{Line}
Attack with a weapon.{Line}Elem-Atk and ST-Atk effects take place.{Line}
Uses items in inventory.{Line}Choose an item to use and select its target to{Line}activate the item.{Line}The window only shows items that can be used in{Line}battle.{Line}
Uses magic in inventory.{Line}Choose magic and select its target to activate.{Line}Magic decreases with use.{Line}Junction effects go down if junctioned magic is used.{Line}
Draws magic out of enemies.{Line}Either {Color Blue}Stock{Color White} to put in inventory or {Color Blue}Cast{Color White} it.

Summons GF.{Line}When chosen, the character begins summoning, and{Line}is unable to act until the GF is summoned.{Line}GF receives all damage while it"s being summoned,{Line}but when its HP goes down to 0, GF is KO"d and the{Line}summon stops.{Line}Status changes affect the character.{Line}If the character is KO"d while summoning, the{Line}summoning process also stops.{Line}The GF appears when summoning is complete.{Line}
Appears before being KO"d.{Line}Each ally has a different skill.{Line}

GF gains experience when junctioned allies fight in{Line}battle.{Line}GF levels up with EXP gained, just as party{Line}members do.{Line}If multiple GF are junctioned to 1 ally, EXP is{Line}divided among GF, and may slow their levels from{Line}going up.{Line}

When you set an ability for a GF to learn in the GF{Line}screen, that GF gains AP in battle.{Line}Once the required number of AP is gained, the{Line}ability is learned.{Line}GF automatically begins learning the next ability.{Line}To choose a specific ability, go to the menu GF{Line}screen.{Line}GF also learns abilities from items, but it can only{Line}learn a maximum of 22 abilities.{Line}

A higher compatibility stat shortens the summoning{Line}time.{Line}Compatibility goes up or down depending on the{Line}junctioned ally"s actions.{Line}Sometimes compatibility with a certain GF goes up, {Line}while it goes down with other GF.{Line}Some items change the compatibility stat.{Line}

{Color Green}Junction{Color White} equips GF and Magic.{Line}Referred to as: Junctioning GF to a character.{Line}”Magic junctioned to a character“ and{Line}”GF junctioned to a character“ fall under this{Line}category.{Line}Junction enables a character to use Magic and{Line}summon GF.{Line}

{Color Green}GF{Color White} signifies {Color Green}Guardian Force{Color White}.{Line}{Line}As allies, they provide the ability to use magic{Line}and commands.{Line}They can also be summoned to fight in a battle.{Line}{Line}GF also gains levels with EXP as you do, and learn{Line}abilities with AP.{Line}

{Color Green}EXP{Color White} signifies experience points gained in battle{Line}by characters and GF.{Line}Levels go up after gaining EXP.{Line}Damaging an enemy gives EXP.{Line}The amount of EXP received changes according{Line}to the difference in character and enemy level.{Line}Higher level enemies are worth more, lower level{Line}enemies are worth less.{Line}The character or the GF to give the final blow{Line}receives bonus EXP.{Line}

{Color Green}AP{Color White} signifies {Color Green}Ability Point{Color White}.{Line}{Line}GF receive AP by defeating enemies.{Line}AP is used by GF to learn abilities.{Line}Once enough AP are gained, GF learns the ability{Line}being studied.{Line}

Attacks are categorized into physical and magic{Line}attacks.{Line}Physical attack means damaging an enemy with{Line}a sword or other physical weapons.{Line}Magic attack means damaging an enemy with{Line}magical force.{Line}{Line}These differences come into play in order to{Line}attack enemies effectively.{Line}

Every character carries magic.{Line}Magic stock decreases when used.{Line}Raise stats by junctioning magic to them.{Line}{Line}There are 3 ways to obtain magic:{Line} ·Draw it from enemies.{Line} ·Draw it from draw points.{Line} ·Refine it from items.{Line}

One of the battle commands.{Line}This command allows allies to draw magic from{Line}enemies.{Line}When drawing, choose either {Color Blue}Stock{Color White} to store the{Line}magic, or {Color Blue}Cast{Color White} to use it.{Line}A character at a high level can draw magic more{Line}efficiently than a character at a low level.{Line}Some magic cannot be drawn unless a character{Line}is at a high level.{Line}
Stock is one of the draw commands.{Line}The command allows characters to store drawn{Line}magic for future use.{Line}It is possible to draw up to 9 units of magic per{Line}draw.{Line}
Cast is one of the draw commands.{Line}The command allows casting of drawn magic.{Line}The effect of the magic on the target is random.{Line}Draw and cast can only use 1 unit of magic.{Line}
A limit break is a special skill characters can use{Line}in dire situations.{Line}Each character has his/her own special attacks.{Line}These moves do a lot of damage against an enemy.{Line}
Every character has 9 stats:{Line}Hit Points, Strength, Vitality, Magic, Spirit, Speed,{Line}Evade, Hit, and Luck.{Line}The values assigned to the stats reflect their level.{Line}

{Option x21}îHP{Line}{Option x21}ïStrength{Line}{Option x21}ñVitality{Line}{Option x21}òMagic {Line}{Option x22} Spirit{Line}{Option x22}0Speed{Line}{Option x22}2Evade{Line}{Option x22}3Hit{Line}{Option x22}1Luck{Line}
{Line}{Color Green}HP{Color White} signifies {Color Green}Hit Points{Color White}.{Line}HP represents the life force of the character.{Line}Zero HP represents KO.{Line}
{Line}The value of Strength determines the degree of{Line}damage caused by a {Color Blue}physical attack{Color White}.{Line}The higher the Strength, the greater the damage{Line}to the enemy.{Line}

{Line}The value of Vitality determines the degree of{Line}damage a character can endure from a physical{Line}attack.{Line}A character with high Vitality suffers less damage{Line}from physical attacks.{Line}

{Line}The value of Magic determines the degree of{Line}damage caused by a magic attack.{Line}Higher Magic causes more magical damage.{Line}The chance of successfully casting magic that{Line}cause status abnormalities becomes higher if your{Line}magic level is high.{Line}A high Magic level also allows you to restore more{Line}HP with healing magic like Cure.{Line}
{Line}The value of Spirit determines the degree of{Line}damage a character can endure from a magic{Line}attack.{Line}A character with high Spirit suffers less damage{Line}from magic attacks.{Line}
{Line}The value of Speed determines the speed of the{Line}character"s ATB meter.{Line}It takes the character a shorter time to act if{Line}this value is high.{Line}
{Line}Luck affects numerous actions of the character{Line}in the game.{Line}For example, having a higher value for Luck is{Line}an advantage during battle.{Line}
{Line}The value for Evade determines the character"s{Line}ability to dodge physical attacks.{Line}Characters that have high Evade can dodge{Line}physical attacks more easily.{Line}

{Line}The value for Hit determines the accuracy of a{Line}physical attack.{Line}Accuracy increases as the Hit level increases.{Line}However, your target"s evade level can affect the{Line}accuracy of your physical attack.{Line}

One of the GF abilities learned through acquiring{Line}AP.{Line}Ability enables characters to use commands and{Line}special powers, but you must junction GF first.{Line}{Line}There are many abilities with different functions,{Line}in roughly 6 categories.{Line}

·These abilities allows junctioning of magic to{Line} stats, elements, and status.{Line} ·Junction a GF that has learned the ability and{Line} set character ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_Junction} icon in the menu.{Line}

·Allows selection of commands in battle.{Line} ·Junction a GF that has learned the ability and{Line} set character ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_Command} icon in the menu.

·Abilities that give specialized powers.{Line} ·Junction a GF that has learned the ability and{Line} set character ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_Character2} icon in the menu.

·Abilities that give the party special powers.{Line} ·Junction a GF that has learned the ability and{Line} set character ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_Party} icon in the menu.{Line}
·Abilities that power up GF.{Line} ·Have GF learn the ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_GF} icon in the menu.{Line}
·Abilities that take effect in the menu.{Line} ·Have GF learn the ability to activate it.{Line} ·Signified by the {Key Ability_Menu} icon on the menu.{Line}
{Option x22}!About Elemental{Line}{Option x22}?Elemental Attack (Elem-Atk){Line}{Option x22}…Elemental Defense (Elem-Def){Line}

{Color Green}Elemental{Color White} is a physical attribute.{Line}There are Fire, Ice, Thunder, Earth, Poison, Wind,{Line}Water, and Holy elements.{Line}This means that Fire magic has Fire properties,{Line}Ice monsters have ice properties, etc.{Line}Damage varies depending on elemental properties.{Line}{Line}There is also a non-elemental property.{Line}Non-elemental is not influenced by other elements.{Line}

Signifies junctioning magic to Elem-Atk.{Line}Only magic with an elemental property can be{Line}junctioned.{Line}Once junctioned, {Color Blue}Attack{Color White} has an elemental property.{Line}An elemental stat is at maximum at 100%.{Line}When attacking an enemy that is susceptible to Fire{Line}attacks, a character inflicts twice the damage if{Line}that character"s Fire stat is at 100%.{Line}But at 50%, damage only amounts to 1.5 times.{Line}

{Color Green}Elem-Def{Color White} signifies Elemental Defense, which sets{Line}an elemental property to your defense.{Line}Certain elemental attacks can be defended against{Line}depending on your Elem-Def element.{Line}Fire Elem-Def protects against fire attacks.{Line}Fire attacks can heal characters who are{Line}completely immune to fire.{Line}Characters who are weak against fire are easily{Line}damaged by fire attacks.{Line}
{Option x22}-About Status{Line}{Option x22}=ST-Atk{Line}{Option x22}*ST-Def{Line}{Option x22}&Status Type{Line}

{Color Green}Status{Color White} signifies status effects, such as Poison{Line}and Petrify.{Line}Status Change means change in a character"s{Line}status.{Line}Besides status like Poison and Petrify, which have{Line}negative effects, there are status changes like{Line}Protect and Double, which benefit the character.{Line}Status changes occur to both enemies and allies.{Line}

{Color Green}ST-Atk{Color White} signifies attacks with status change{Line}or which have status change added to them.{Line}After setting status change to an attack, the{Line}attack will change an enemy"s status.{Line}Most magic has a status change, such as Sleep,{Line}which causes the Sleep status.{Line}

{Color Green}ST-Def{Color White} signifies status defense, either already{Line}in use, or actually setting a status to defense.{Line}This defends against certain status changes.{Line}If attacked by Petrify while the defense is set{Line}against Petrify, a status change doesn"t occur.{Line}

A country on the world"s smallest continent.{Line}Known for its temperate climate and warm people.{Line}Balamb Garden adds a school-town feel to this{Line}country.{Line}
A cavern near Balamb Garden where a Fire element{Line}GF lives.{Line}
A small country on the eastern coast of Galbadia{Line}continent (formerly Dollet).{Line}Remnants of an ancient empire.{Line}

A city located south of Dollet in the forest area.{Line}It was an independent country before neighboring{Line}country Galbadia invaded 18 years ago.{Line}There are numerous resistance groups fighting for{Line}independence to this day.{Line}
All forms of communication now use HD cables.{Line}No radio transmissions are used.{Line}Timber TV Station keeps its radio systems, waiting{Line}for the day radio transmission is restored.{Line}

Ruled under the military dictatorship of President{Line}Vinzer Deling, this country continues to expand its{Line}territory.{Line}Countless invasions of other countries are{Line}attempted, but most are deterred by SeeD.{Line}Deling City is its capital.{Line}

Located north of Deling City; the burial place of{Line}Dollet Empire"s last emperor.{Line}The tomb remains nameless due to the ancient{Line}belief that calling a dead king by his name brings{Line}bad luck.{Line}There are uncomfirmed reports that a GF resides{Line}inside, as well as other monsters.{Line}
A small town outside of Galbadia.{Line}It is actually a small village.{Line}Sorceress Adel of Esthar ordered attacks on this{Line}village several times.{Line}

Located in the desert south of Deling City,{Line}all people deemed dangerous by the government{Line}are sent to this facility.{Line}It has become a symbol of President Deling"s{Line}fascist policies.{Line}

Galbadia"s long-range missile base.{Line}As the only country to own long range missiles with{Line}the exception of Esthar, they pose a major security{Line}threat to the world.{Line}It is believed that the missiles are armed with a{Line}target-lock mechanism.{Line}The details are unknown.{Line}
A railroad that connected the East and West{Line}continents.{Line}Completed about the time war broke out, it was only{Line}in use a short time.{Line}Since then it has been derelict.{Line}
A station located in the center of Horizon Bridge.{Line}It"s now a haven for expatriates who refused to{Line}have their skills exploited by the government.{Line}
A country on the northern continent.{Line}Due to the harsh climate, Moombas and the Shumi{Line}tribe are the only occupants.{Line}Trabia Garden students and faculty also reside{Line}here.{Line}

Founded by people who immigrated to a continent{Line}east of Centra around the same time Dollet Empire{Line}was founded.{Line}The mild climate and temperament of the people{Line}soon gave way to scientific advancement.{Line}

Started the Sorceress War and fought against the{Line}world under Adel"s rule.{Line}Their sorceress and their scientific powers posed{Line}a worldwide threat.{Line}After abruptly declaring an end to the war, Esthar{Line}closed its borders and has kept its silence ever{Line}since.{Line}No details are known.{Line}

Governed by President Laguna and his aides.{Line}Due to their concern over Dr. Odine"s inventions{Line}having a negative effect on the state of world{Line}security, they closed off their country for 17{Line}years.{Line}It is very likely that President Laguna will be{Line}criticized for keeping silent for so long.{Line}
A station on the Esthar side of Horizon Bridge.{Line}It is currently abandoned.{Line}
A lake on the Esthar continent.{Line}What used to be a beautiful lake is now a barren{Line}field.{Line}It"s speculated that Esthar"s experiments led to{Line}the lake"s destruction.{Line}
A world of monsters.{Line}Many works of art and epics about the moon{Line}throughout history are evidence of its mystical{Line}powers.{Line}

A man-made mobile island for marine life research.{Line}Disappeared mysteriously after much wandering.{Line}Since the facility members are still alive, it is{Line}assumed to be concealed intentionally.{Line}{Line}3015 Found a strong energy field{Line}4141 Call this place Deep Sea Deposit{Line}4242 Seal off Deep Sea Deposit{Line}
Marine Research Island"s last excavation site.{Line}Believed to be an ocean floor ruin.{Line}There is a note saying:{Line}4127 Travel by Underwater Tower.{Line}

By examining the Draw Points in the field and on{Line}the world map, you can draw magic.{Line}The Draw Points on the World Map are completely{Line}hidden.{Line}Examine odd-looking areas carefully.{Line}

A complete mystery. Various states of ”present“{Line}are believed to become compressed.{Line}Sorceress" power from many generations may cross{Line}over to give 1 sorceress great strength.{Line}No one knows what effect this may have on regular{Line}human beings.{Line}

Balamb Garden was founded 12 years ago, followed{Line}by Galbadia and Trabia Gardens.{Line}Each Garden has an administrator, called Master,{Line}and a headmaster.{Line}Balamb Garden"s Headmaster Cid was the founder{Line}of the Garden.{Line}

Balamb Garden"s mercenary force.{Line}Students 15 and older can participate in the{Line}written and field exams.{Line}They must pass both exams to become SeeD.{Line}SeeD members are paid by the Garden according to{Line}their rank.{Line}In the Garden, their status is no different from{Line}that of the other students.{Line}

SeeD conducts missions around the world.{Line}Most missions involve battle support and undercover{Line}work.{Line}SeeD is in high demand by groups requiring a small{Line}force of undercover specialists.{Line}Commissions made through such dispatches are an{Line}important part of Balamb Garden"s income.{Line}

SeeD battle operations are noted for their skillful{Line}use of para-magic.{Line}Balamb Garden researches the use of GF in{Line}conjunction with para-magic.{Line}For this, Balamb Garden SeeD members master the{Line}most powerful forms of para-magic.{Line}
Shows your skill level as a SeeD.{Line}Higher ranks command a higher salary.{Line}

Exam to test your SeeD knowledge.{Line}After becoming a SeeD, you can take the tests in{Line}the Tutorial.{Line}There are up to 30 levels, with 10 questions each.{Line}All answers must be correct to go up a rank.{Line}However, you can only takes tests up to{Line}{Char Squall}"s level.{Line}
A haven for orphans founded by Sorceress Edea{Line}and Headmaster Cid.{Line}Named for their wish to raise the seeds of the{Line}future in their garden.{Line}

A phenomenon beginning with Esthar"s silence 17{Line}years ago.{Line}Almost all radio communication facilities were shut{Line}down because of noise across all frequencies.{Line}However, short transmissions are still possible.{Line}Believed to have some relation to the moon, but{Line}details are unknown.{Line}

Most countries now communicate through the use{Line}of HD cables running underground.{Line}However, many of these cables are cut off by{Line}monsters or in battle.{Line}Many countries are left without any means to{Line}communicate with each other.{Line}

Refers to monsters falling from the moon.{Line}Completely destroyed the cities of Centra.{Line}Occurs when monsters reach a saturation point on{Line}the moon.{Line}It"s believed that there are factors on the planet{Line}that cause this phenomenon.{Line}This phenonmenon has occured many times in{Line}history and will reoccur in the future.{Line}

Creatures on the moon. Monsters fall to earth at{Line}regular intervals.{Line}This phenomenon is called the Lunar Cry.{Line}The monsters bred on the planet since the last{Line}Lunar Cry make up those roaming the planet at this{Line}time.{Line}The Lunar Cry phenomenon also transformed some{Line}animals into monsters.{Line}

A civilization in Centra 4000 years ago.{Line}These Centra people immigrated to other continents{Line}and founded the Dollet Empire to the west and{Line}Esthar to the east.{Line}Centra was destroyed 80 years ago by the Lunar{Line}Cry.{Line}
A device to restrain sorceresses" power.{Line}Dr. Odine, afraid of Sorceress Adel"s power,{Line}created it.{Line}It looks like beautiful jewelry.{Line}

The legend goes that the Great Hyne created{Line}people.{Line}The sorceresses were given a fragment of Hyne"s{Line}own power.{Line}It"s hard to determine how many sorceresses exist{Line}today, for many keep their powers concealed.{Line}However, it is believed that they avoid spreading{Line}their power too thin.{Line}
Sorceress power has been passed throughout{Line}history by the process of embodiment.{Line}Any person who has the capacity to embody the{Line}great sorceress power is a candidate.{Line}

When a sorceress is about to die, she gives her{Line}power to the next person who ‘inherits" her{Line}sorceress powers.{Line}According to Odine"s research, the power tends to{Line}weaken with each succession.{Line}

A crystal that causes the Lunar Cry by producing{Line}a strong energy field between the planet and the{Line}moon.{Line}It"s believed to have originated in the moon.{Line}The Crystal Pillar responds to a specific location{Line}on the planet, and sends a strong directional signal.{Line}More research is required to analyze this process{Line}in detail.{Line}

An enclosure for Crystal Pillar made by Esthar.{Line}3 miles tall and 1.5 miles wide, the enormous{Line}enclosure boasts a high-tech facility.{Line}It floats by causing a reaction with the Crystal{Line}Pillar.{Line}A stone from the moon is sealed inside.{Line}It was probably built to cause the Lunar Cry{Line}through artificial means.{Line}

Lunar Cry"s point of origin determined by Esthar{Line}scientists.{Line}A security box restraining the power of the Crystal{Line}Pillar and ground energy field is set up.{Line}It is sealed to prevent the Crystal Pillar from{Line}entering the area.{Line}

A high-tech device intended for weakening and{Line}confining a sorceress" power.{Line}Shot into the moon"s orbit after going through a{Line}special sealing process.{Line}Used to confine Sorceress Adel.{Line}It is the main cause of radio interference on the{Line}planet.{Line}

Esthar"s space shuttle.{Line}Based on an ancient Centra legend of the Dragon{Line}Ship,{Line}Esthar"s finest scientific technology was used to{Line}build it.{Line}Esthar"s flagship, until it was used to send Adel"s{Line}Tomb into space.{Line}
Balamb Garden"s foundation.{Line}The original structure of Centra Shelter remains{Line}almost entirely intact.{Line}Entry is strictly forbidden.{Line}

(Later became the Garden building.){Line}Ancient Centra people spread around the world{Line}after Centra was destroyed by the Lunar Cry.{Line}People used mobile Centra Shelters to move around{Line}the world.{Line}Many ruined shelters are found around the world.{Line}
A magazine representing the people"s voice.{Line}It was popular among aspiring young journalists.{Line}Shut down after Galbadia deemed the publication{Line}dangerous.{Line}

Julia Heartilly"s song.{Line}Julia married the Galbadian General Caraway after{Line}releasing “Eyes On Me“.{Line}Gave birth to a girl one year later.{Line}Julia died in a car crash at age 28, right before{Line}her daughter turned 5.{Line}

Creator of mankind, and believed to be the first{Line}sorceress.{Line}Calling a sorceress the Great Hyne"s descendant{Line}shows great respect.{Line}

Junction enables{Line}characters to power up{Line}and use abilities.
A GF must be junctioned{Line}in order to power up{Line}and use abilities.
Right now, no GF is junctioned.
All other commands in gray{Line}cannot be selected yet.
the GF and Magic commands appear.
Since no GF is junctioned,{Line}Magic is displayed in gray.
Press {Key Cards} to see abilities{Line}possessed by a GF.
The abilities are{Line}HP Junction,{Line}Vitality Junction, etc.
HP-J and Vit-J make the stats{Line}HP and Vit appear in white.
Magic can now be{Line}junctioned to HP and Vit.
But, since there is currently{Line}no magic, we will move onto
and 2 non-command abilities{Line}for characters and party.
A total of 5 abilities can be set.
Depending on the GF"s{Line}abilities, the maximum is{Line}4 non-command abilities.
This means that up to 7{Line}abilities can be set.
The top window is for Command{Line}abilities used during battle.
The bottom window is for{Line}character and party abilities.
Selecting the top window{Line}displays command abilities,
and selecting the bottom window displays{Line}character and party abilities.
let"s set the command ability,{Line}Draw, to get some magic.
When an empty slot is chosen,
the cursor moves to the right.
Select Draw to set{Line}the command, Draw.
This is how command abilities{Line}used during battle are set.
Let"s add GF and Item to{Line}the list of command abilities.
Now GF and Item are set.
This concludes the tutorial.{Line}Thank you, and good luck.
By junctioning magic, you{Line}can raise the character"s stats.
If the GF has learned the ability
to junction onto stats, that{Line}particular stat will be{Line}displayed in white.
the GF and Magic commands will appear.
You are able to junction magic{Line}by selecting Magic.
Use the cursor to select{Line}which stat to junction.
choose a magic with the cursor.
You can see how the stat value{Line}changes with each magic.
the magic will be displayed next{Line}to the stat and the value will change.
Only one magic can be{Line}assigned to each stat.
there is no need to junction{Line}magic manually, one by one.
Thus, magic can be junctioned{Line}easily by using Auto.
For example, let"s select{Line}the Atk junction.
Magic has been junctioned{Line}to favor Strength.
Junction can change basic{Line}parameters such as Strength{Line}and Magic, as well as
By junctioning a GF with{Line}elemental junction ability,
the EL-A/D slot above HP turns white,{Line}indicating an elemental junction.
First, select a stat to junction,
then choose a magic to{Line}finish the junction.
However, non-elemental magic{Line}like Cure cannot be junctioned.
Elemental junction affects{Line}attack and defense differently.
links that element to a character"s Attack.
The % indicates how much of the attack"s{Line}damage is linked to that element.
At the maximum value of 100%,{Line}the Attack becomes entirely elemental.
In the example, Ice is at 50%; this{Line}means that damage only increases by 50%.
the damage from that element is reduced.
Reduction of damage is shown in %.{Line}At 100%, damage is reduced to 0.
In the example, fire damage is{Line}reduced to 20%, because Elem-Def{Line}is at 80%.
{Key Star} is displayed when the value goes over{Line}100%, indicating that damage is absorbed.
In this state, you can absorb the{Line}amount of damage indicated in %.
In the example, 50% of fire{Line}damage is absorbed.
Multiple magic types can be junctioned{Line}to Elem-Def, depending on the GF"s ability.
Junction multiple magic types with the{Line}same elemental for a cumulative effect.
Try junctioning different{Line}magic to check the effect.
You can also select Auto to{Line}automatically junction the most{Line}effective elemental magic.
By junctioning a GF with{Line}status junction ability,
the ST-A/D slot above HP turns{Line}white, indicating a status junction.
Status junction works the same{Line}way as elemental junction.
First, select a stat to junction,
then select a magic to{Line}complete the junction.
magic with no status change,{Line}like Fire, cannot be junctioned.
Status junction affects{Line}attack and defense differently.
gives that status change to Attack.
The status change probability is{Line}indicated in %.
In the example, there is a 90% chance{Line}of afflicting an enemy with Darkness.
100% is the maximum value, but there{Line}are enemies who may not be affected,{Line}even with 100% ST-Atk.
reduces the probability of status change.
Probability is displayed in %.{Line}No status change will occur at 100%.
In the example, the effect of Sleep{Line}attack is reduced by 80%.
However, depending on the enemy attack,{Line}status change may still occur at 100%.
You can junction multiple magic types{Line}to ST-Def, depending on the GF"s ability.
Some magic, like Esuna, will{Line}defend against multiple status changes.
Try junctioning different{Line}magic to check the effect.
Select Auto to junction{Line}the most effective status{Line}magic automatically.
A GF will level up{Line}as it gains experience (EXP),
and learn new abilities{Line}by gaining AP (Ability Points).
EXP gained from battles{Line}automatically levels up the GF,
can be distributed, to{Line}learn different abilities.
Decide how to distribute the points.
Let"s go over how{Line}a GF can learn{Line}different abilities.
Select GF from the menu{Line}to display the GF acquired.
This displays its EXP, LV,{Line}and compatibility between{Line}characters, etc., but
Abilities in white, such as{Line}Str-J are abilities already learned,
while abilities in gray{Line}have not been learned yet.
shows the AP spent towards learning,
and the second number shows{Line}the AP required to complete.
Vit-J shows that 50 AP{Line}are required, of which 0 AP{Line}has been spent.
In order to learn the{Line}ability Elem-Atk-J,
Elem-Atk-J will then be displayed{Line}to the left, under Learning.
From here on, all AP gained{Line}will be used for Elem-Atk-J.
When all 160 AP are gained,{Line}Elem-Atk-J is learned.
Once an ability is{Line}learned, AP will
automatically move to an{Line}ability not yet learned.
With each learned ability{Line}comes a different set of{Line}abilities to learn.
The order of learning{Line}affects the GF"s powers.
it is recommended to{Line}return to this screen to{Line}set the next ability.
This concludes the tutorial.{Line}Thank you, and good luck.
The Status Screen displays{Line}each character"s basic{Line}data.
The first status screen shows{Line}stats such as HP, Str, etc.
The second screen shows all the status{Line}and elemental-related information.
The third status screen shows{Line}GF-related information.
The fourth status screen shows{Line}Limit Break information.
{Char Squall}"s gunblade settings can be changed{Line}in the Limit Break screen.

If you select{Line}Gunblade Auto to ON,
Renzokuken hits automatically{Line}without having to press {Key RotateRight}.
However, a ‘Perfect" may not be possible{Line}with this option. You must select OFF
and press {Key RotateRight} manually at the right time.
the indicator will not be{Line}displayed during Renzokuken.

That"s all for{Line}{Char Squall}"s Limit Break.

the Limit Break Duel{Line}will execute automatically.

The tricks {Char Angelo2} can learn are{Line}listed on the Status screen.
The fourth status screen lists all the{Line}tricks that {Char Angelo2} can learn.
The gauge on the right indicates{Line}how much has been learned.
When the gauge is full,{Line}the trick has been learned.
If the gauge is not full,{Line}the trick has yet to be learned.
move the cursor to the trick{Line}name and press {Key Confirm}.
Now as {Char Rinoa} walks around, the gauge{Line}will fill up, and {Char Angelo2} will learn the trick.
If you select a trick{Line}that has already been learned,
there will be a message{Line}before you close this screen.
If there is still a trick to{Line}learn, be sure to select it.
You can learn new tricks{Line}by reading a magazine called{Line}Pet Pals.
After reading Pet Pals, access{Line}this screen to change the settings.
That"s all for{Line}{Char Rinoa}"s Limit Breaks.
